column2: Please indicate your role within the organization:
column3: How long have you been working in the NGS
column4: How often do you handle sensitive NGS data that could be targeted in a cybersecurity attack
column5: How often do you open emails from unknown senders as part of your work
column6: Have you ever used a personal USB drive or other external storage devices to transfer NGS data
column7: Do you follow a process to verify the security of websites or links before accessing them, especially when related to NGS research
column8: Have you ever shared your login credentials with a colleague, even if you believed it was for a legitimate purpose
column9: In the event of receiving a suspicious email, what actions do you typically take (Select all that apply)
column10: Has there been an instance where you accessed NGS data from a public Wi-Fi network
column11: How frequently do you engage in non-work-related activities (e.g., browsing social media, personal emails) on devices used to access NGS data systems
column12: Do you regularly update your computer, smartphone, and other devices with the latest security patches and software updates
column13: Have you ever fallen victim to a phishing email or scam
column14: Are you aware of the potential cybersecurity risks associated with next-generation sequencing (NGS) technologies
column15: Do you understand the importance of securing genomic data generated by NGS technologies to protect patient privacy and confidentiality
column16: Are you familiar with common cybersecurity threats and vulnerabilities that can affect NGS data, such as data breaches, ransomware attacks, unauthorized access, fishing attack,  targeted attacks on genomic data or manipulation of sequencing results
column17: Have you implemented data backup and disaster recovery plans to ensure the resilience of NGS data in the event of cyberattacks or system failures
column18: How often does your organization provide cybersecurity training specifically tailored to NGS operations
column19: How confident are you in identifying a cybersecurity threat specific to NGS operations
column20: Does your organization have clear and accessible cybersecurity policies specific to NGS operations
column21: Have you experienced any cybersecurity incidents or breaches related to NGS data in the past
column22: How often do you participate in cybersecurity training or awareness programs specifically tailored for NGS data security
column23: When handling sensitive NGS data, which of the following practices do you regularly follow (Select all that apply)
column24: Have you or anyone in your team ever detected a potential cybersecurity threat
column25: How confident are you in identifying a cybersecurity threat specific to NGS operations
column26: How would you describe the overall culture of cybersecurity within your organization
column27: How relevant do you find the cybersecurity training content to your day-to-day responsibilities
column28: In your opinion, what are the biggest barriers to implementing effective cybersecurity training in your organization (Select all that apply)
column29: Have you ever received suspicious emails or messages that you suspect may target NGS data or systems
column30: Has your organization ever experienced a cybersecurity breach that affected NGS or any other sensitive data
column31: Do you feel that cybersecurity should be a priority in your NGS relates tasks or experiments
column32: Do you use encryption techniques to secure NGS data during transmission and storage
column33: Do you collaborate with cybersecurity experts or professionals to enhance the security posture of NGS systems and data
column34: Since the last cybersecurity training session, have you encountered situations where you applied the knowledge learned
column35: Do you feel that the  careless behaviors could lead to potential cybersecurity risks to the sensitive and private data in NGS
column36: Has there been a cybersecurity incident within your organization such as hacking, password stealing etc.,  that led to changes or enhancements in the training program or policy change
column37: Does your organization have clear and accessible cybersecurity policies specific to NGS operations or sensitive healthcare data such as DNA sequencing data
column38: In the last year, how often has cybersecurity been discussed in your meetings or other organizational communications
column39: What methods does your organization use to communicate about cybersecurity issues (Select all that apply)
column41: Have you heard about the term Bio-Cyber Security

column9: Open the email out of curiosity, Click on links within the email to see where they lead, Download and open attachments to determine their relevance
